intro: Schwenckia alvaroana, commonly known as the alvaroan starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Schwenckia alvaroana is a member of the Montiaceae family and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological significance in its native habitat.
